tests/array/array_spec.c - libcspec_book

Table of Contents

  2. #include "array.h"
  3. #include <cspec/cspec.h>
  4. #include <assert.h>
  5. #include <stdlib.h>


  8. DESCRIBE(array_new, "array_t* array_new(size_t element_size)") {
  9.     IT("returns not-NULL pointer") {
  10.         array_t* array = array_new(1);
  11.         SHOULD_NOT_BE_NULL(array);
  12.         array_delete(&array);
  13.     } END_IT;

  15.     IT("returns initialized struct") {
  16.         array_t* array = array_new(2);
  17.         SHOULD_EQUAL(array->element_size, 2);
  18.         SHOULD_EQUAL(array->size, 0);
  19.         SHOULD_EQUAL(array->capacity, 0);
  20.         SHOULD_BE_NULL(array->data);
  21.         array_delete(&array);
  22.     } END_IT;

  24.     IT("returns NULL if element size is 0") {
  25.         SHOULD_BE_NULL(array_new(0));
  26.     } END_IT;
  27. } END_DESCRIBE;


  30. DESCRIBE(array_delete, "void array_delete(array_t** const array)")
  31. {
  32.     IT("destruct struct") {
  33.         array_t* array = array_new(1);
  34.         array->size = 1;
  35.         array->capacity = 10;
  36.         array->data = malloc(array->capacity);
  37.         if (NULL == array->data) {
  38.             exit(1);
  39.         }
  40.         array_delete(&array);
  41.         SHOULD_BE_NULL(array);
  42.     } END_IT;

  44.     IT("do nothing if pointer is NULL") {
  45.         array_delete(NULL);
  46.         SHOULD_BE_TRUE(1);
  47.     } END_IT;

  49.     IT("do nothing if *array is NULL") {
  50.         array_t* array = NULL;
  51.         array_delete(&array);
  52.         SHOULD_BE_NULL(array);
  53.     } END_IT;
  54. } END_DESCRIBE;


  57. DESCRIBE(array_add, "int array_add(array_t* const array, const void* const data)")
  58. {
  59.     IT("add an element into the array") {
  60.         int data;
  61.         array_t* array;
  62.         int ret;

  64.         array = array_new(sizeof(int));
  65.         assert(NULL != array);

  67.         data = 2;
  68.         ret = array_add(array, &data);
  69.         SHOULD_EQUAL(ret, 0);
  70.         SHOULD_EQUAL(array->size, 1);
  71.         SHOULD_BE_TRUE(1 * sizeof(int) <= array->capacity);
  72.         SHOULD_NOT_BE_NULL(array->data);
  73.         SHOULD_EQUAL(*((int*) array_get_element(array, 0)), 2);
  74.         SHOULD_BE_NULL(array_get_element(array, 1));

  76.         data = -1;
  77.         ret = array_add(array, &data);
  78.         SHOULD_EQUAL(ret, 0);
  79.         SHOULD_EQUAL(array->size, 2);
  80.         SHOULD_BE_TRUE(2 * sizeof(int) <= array->capacity);

  82.         array_delete(&array);
  83.     } END_IT;

  85.     IT("returns 1 if either pointer is NULL") {
  86.         short data;
  87.         array_t array;
  88.         int ret = array_add(NULL, &data);
  89.         SHOULD_EQUAL(ret, 1);
  90.         ret = array_add(&array, NULL);
  91.         SHOULD_EQUAL(ret, 1);
  92.     } END_IT;
  93. } END_DESCRIBE;


  96. DESCRIBE(array_get_element, "void* array_get_element(array_t* const array, size_t idx)")
  97. {
  98.     IT("return NULL if idx is over bound") {
  99.         array_t* array = array_new(sizeof(int));
  100.         SHOULD_BE_NULL(array_get_element(array, 1));
  101.         array_delete(&array);
  102.     } END_IT;

  104.     IT("return NULL if pointer is NULL") {
  105.         SHOULD_BE_NULL(array_get_element(NULL, 0));
  106.     } END_IT;
  107. } END_DESCRIBE;
